abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the three Niger projects
            vary greatly.  The Pilot Private Irrigation Project (PPIP)
            had a highly satisfactory outcome; risk to the development
            outcome was significant; and both Bank and Borrower
            performances were satisfactory. The Natural Resources
            Management Project (NRMP) had a satisfactory outcome, risk
            to the development outcome was moderate; and satisfactory
            performances by both the Bank and Borrower. The
            Agro-Pastoral Export Promotion Project (APEP) had a  highly
            unsatisfactory outcome; risk to the development outcome was
            high; and unsatisfactory performances by both the Bank and
            the Borrower. Lessons learned from the projects included:
            empowering communities to take control of the implementation
            of their own development plans improves community ownership
            and motivation to engage in sustainable development
            practices. Export development needs to follow a well defined
            strategy, and a commodity chain approach needs to emphasize
            producer-exporter linkages. Similar agricultural development
            projects in neighboring countries can have opposite outcomes
            due to the quality of project preparation, the level of
            engagement of the implementing agencies, and the prevailing
            land tenure security situation.
